Servicing Facilities
14.
It is important to the continued use of radio as an educational tool
that the radio receiver he kept operating satisfactorily.
It may he serviced hy staff service personnel, hy contracted commercial
personnel, or hy vocational students. Whatever the arrangement it must
provide fast and satisfactory repairs, and it must he routed through the
office of the director of radio education.
With the advent of television and the probability of many classroom reÂ¬
ceivers, it would he well to consider establishing staff service personnel
to maintain and repair radio and television sets.
